results.content: I’ve been searching for a Data Privacy/GDPR course in order to prepare me for the CIPM and CIPP/E certifications.  Even though I have experience, I needed a deep dive and mentoring from someone with more experience.  The info is not only clear and concise,  but it also provides examples which are key.
results.content_html: I’ve been searching for a Data Privacy/GDPR course in order to prepare me for the CIPM and CIPP/E certifications. Even though I have experience, I needed a deep dive and mentoring from someone with more experience. The info is not only clear and concise, but it also provides examples which are key.

results.content:
I don't believe this course achieves what it claims to achieve. 

I purchased this course in order to help me pass IAPP's 2020 versions of the CIPT, CIPP & CIPM exams, which is what the course author claims it is designed to do. I've now watched all the material and can categorically state that there has been very little mention of any of the key topics outlined in IAPP's exam blueprints for any of these courses. The pass 'guarantees' (for IAPP's CIPP, CIPM & CIPT) that the author makes in the initial videos of this particular course (Build EU GDPR Data Protection Compliance from Scratch) prompted me to purchase all five of his Data Privacy-related courses on UDEMY. In other words, I was expecting that after 12.5 hours of videos, the course would cover quite a lot of relevant material.

I don't normally give bad reviews, but this is a subject with which I'm very familiar. I've not only worked in Data Protection & Information Security for around 15 years, but I've also recently purchased all IAPP's course materials for all three of IAPP's main certifications (CIPM, CIPP & CIPT) and, as a result, have a fairly clear understanding of what the exams require candidates to know. I am certainly not speaking without foundation when I say that this course quite simply does not deliver on the information or concepts necessary to pass these exams! Why, for example, all the stuff on the Payment Services Directive (PSD2)? Surely that's just 'bloat material' intended to make the course looks like it covers more relevant material than is actually does? PSD2 certainly doesn't feature in any of IAPP's official syllabuses...not as far as I can see, anyway!

I shall issue similarly candid reviews as and when I get through the remaining four courses but, if this one is anything to go by, I'm not expecting much!
results.content_html:
I don't believe this course achieves what it claims to achieve.

I purchased this course in order to help me pass IAPP's 2020 versions of the CIPT, CIPP & CIPM exams, which is what the course author claims it is designed to do. I've now watched all the material and can categorically state that there has been very little mention of any of the key topics outlined in IAPP's exam blueprints for any of these courses. The pass 'guarantees' (for IAPP's CIPP, CIPM & CIPT) that the author makes in the initial videos of this particular course (Build EU GDPR Data Protection Compliance from Scratch) prompted me to purchase all five of his Data Privacy-related courses on UDEMY. In other words, I was expecting that after 12.5 hours of videos, the course would cover quite a lot of relevant material.

I don't normally give bad reviews, but this is a subject with which I'm very familiar. I've not only worked in Data Protection & Information Security for around 15 years, but I've also recently purchased all IAPP's course materials for all three of IAPP's main certifications (CIPM, CIPP & CIPT) and, as a result, have a fairly clear understanding of what the exams require candidates to know. I am certainly not speaking without foundation when I say that this course quite simply does not deliver on the information or concepts necessary to pass these exams! Why, for example, all the stuff on the Payment Services Directive (PSD2)? Surely that's just 'bloat material' intended to make the course looks like it covers more relevant material than is actually does? PSD2 certainly doesn't feature in any of IAPP's official syllabuses...not as far as I can see, anyway!

I shall issue similarly candid reviews as and when I get through the remaining four courses but, if this one is anything to go by, I'm not expecting much!

results.content: There are several problems.  The instructor, while knowledgeable, just speaks in front of a camera the entire time.  2. The course does not provide a practical real world example of transitioning to GDPR. 3. There is not much in the way of 'implement a compliant program via these concrete steps'.  4. There is much hype that seems on the surface about GDPR, but without identifying solutions, I am left to conclude that the instructor is attempting to boost their own consulting business.

results.content: It’s not really clear what he author is trying to accomplish. Section 7 should be 1 and then he should have gone to each section to explain how to be compliant.,

response.content:
Hi Jeewa, well, the course starts with some concepts about GDPR and creates an implementation plan. Following the implementation plan, in order for you to be able to create and customize the docs shared in section 7, you need to understand some privacy concepts. Then section 7 comes into action in order to share the docs and allows you to practice what you have learned till now. And in the end, i am showing you some technology examples that could fit and fill in the gaps discovered with the Gap Assessment.
Let me know if it is more clear.
I really hope you will see the value of the course and you will find the course as being a 5 star one till the end.
Thx in advance for being one of my students
Roland
response.content_html:
Hi Jeewa, well, the course starts with some concepts about GDPR and creates an implementation plan. Following the implementation plan, in order for you to be able to create and customize the docs shared in section 7, you need to understand some privacy concepts. Then section 7 comes into action in order to share the docs and allows you to practice what you have learned till now. And in the end, i am showing you some technology examples that could fit and fill in the gaps discovered with the Gap Assessment.
Let me know if it is more clear.
I really hope you will see the value of the course and you will find the course as being a 5 star one till the end.
Thx in advance for being one of my students
Roland

results.content:
This is yet another great course from Roland Costea on Digital Privacy/Data Protection/GDPR! 
The quality and density of the course are very high, often requiring to pause the video to fully digest the significance and reach of what is being said. And yet the course is well paced and the speaker has the ability to keep the energy and the focus up.
Very impressive!

This is yet another great course from Roland Costea on Digital Privacy/Data Protection/GDPR!

Very impressive!

results.content:
I liked the way he designed the course. It's beneficial even if you don't have a basic knowledge of GDPR.

1. Course: It covers high-level topics, and anyone can build EU GDPR data protection compliance from scratch with some supporting documents.
2. Q&A: Roland politely answers all the questions related to GDPR.
3. Documents: The language used in the documents is easy, and one business can quickly adopt the policies and implement to comply with the GDPR laws.

I'd strongly recommend this course.

Doesn’t hold attention. Redundant with shorter courses. More on general security practices vs GDPR specific checklist

results.content: This is a comprehensive course about privacy and security. The focus isn't solely on GDPR but on the underlying infrastructure which might be off-putting at times because the amount of detail in regard to privacy concepts and foundational elements is really explained in depth. This is surely a course for company owners, less for individuals. I'm not satisfied that the previously mentioned lessons had greater importance to the instructor than the ones which were actually about implementing GDPR itself. There is a discrepancy between the vocabulary knowledge of the instructor and his pronunciation which sometimes does interfere with comprehension. The section on Microsoft Azure also applies to medium-sized companies that base quite a significant amount of their business activity in the cloud or have a lot of departments. The documents provided are really useful to have and serve as a guide when implementing GDPR.
results.content_html: This is a comprehensive course about privacy and security. The focus isn't solely on GDPR but on the underlying infrastructure which might be off-putting at times because the amount of detail in regard to privacy concepts and foundational elements is really explained in depth. This is surely a course for company owners, less for individuals. I'm not satisfied that the previously mentioned lessons had greater importance to the instructor than the ones which were actually about implementing GDPR itself. There is a discrepancy between the vocabulary knowledge of the instructor and his pronunciation which sometimes does interfere with comprehension. The section on Microsoft Azure also applies to medium-sized companies that base quite a significant amount of their business activity in the cloud or have a lot of departments. The documents provided are really useful to have and serve as a guide when implementing GDPR.

results.content: One way transmission of knowledge-in many cases slides were being read from prepared scripts. No illustrative case studies to make the topic interesting
results.content_html: One way transmission of knowledge-in many cases slides were being read from prepared scripts. No illustrative case studies to make the topic interesting

results.content:
It is rather early in this course (just after lesson 3) to be able to say how I feel about it... The prospect looks fine and I'm eager to get into the details of this topic. Right now I'm content about the narration to be clear and understandable to non native english speakers. The quality of the audio differs considarably between the lessons though.
The later lessons have a consistently high audio quality (I'm at lesson 77 right now). You have to keep on learning at a reasonable pace or the trainer will improve the lessons before you managed to complete them - so better hurry ;-) The additions to the course were a substiantial improvement for me so I'm grateful for the even increased value.
results.content_html:
It is rather early in this course (just after lesson 3) to be able to say how I feel about it... The prospect looks fine and I'm eager to get into the details of this topic. Right now I'm content about the narration to be clear and understandable to non native english speakers. The quality of the audio differs considarably between the lessons though.
The later lessons have a consistently high audio quality (I'm at lesson 77 right now). You have to keep on learning at a reasonable pace or the trainer will improve the lessons before you managed to complete them - so better hurry ;-) The additions to the course were a substiantial improvement for me so I'm grateful for the even increased value.

results.content:
Great content. Covers a very broad area and a lot of topics. Only drawback is that it is hard to stay focused from time to time as all is presented in a somewhat monotonous matter.
I mainly used the course supporting my CIPT exam efforts, while I already was CIPP/E and CIPM certified.

results.content:
Obviously a very knowledgeable and intelligent individual. Just 2 things I found less helpful. 

1. It felt like a lot of information he was presenting was superfluous to me getting the information I needed or was required to know in order to follow a certification path. (Although, this could of course just be his leader course as he does mention his "other" courses for those wanting to follow certification).

2. Due to language pronunciation influences and differences, I found I ended up focussing more on ensuring I was understanding correctly what he was saying rather than the material being presented. I imagine for anyone w. English as as second language, it might be even more so.
results.content_html:
Obviously a very knowledgeable and intelligent individual. Just 2 things I found less helpful.

1. It felt like a lot of information he was presenting was superfluous to me getting the information I needed or was required to know in order to follow a certification path. (Although, this could of course just be his leader course as he does mention his "other" courses for those wanting to follow certification).

2. Due to language pronunciation influences and differences, I found I ended up focussing more on ensuring I was understanding correctly what he was saying rather than the material being presented. I imagine for anyone w. English as as second language, it might be even more so.

results.content:
An extremely interesting, detailed and, at the same time, concise presentation of the complicated legal framework and requirements in the field of data protection with valuable tips from lecturer's individual professional experience! Really intuitive design and great value for money! Very engaging author and lecturer! The course could be even better if the lecturer included useful references for further reading on the subject.
I completed the course feeling confident and well informed! Roland, thank you very much indeed for this wonderful course!

results.content:
This course really isn't great. It's not actionable at all. Little is done, to make the concepts easy to grasp. It is literally just one man explaining GDPR to a camera while being incredibly vague.

This course should add visualizations. Also, the teacher should really look into how to apply an easy-to-follow structure to his teaching.
results.content_html:
This course really isn't great. It's not actionable at all. Little is done, to make the concepts easy to grasp. It is literally just one man explaining GDPR to a camera while being incredibly vague.

This course should add visualizations. Also, the teacher should really look into how to apply an easy-to-follow structure to his teaching.

results.content: Clear and high quality contents
results.content_html: Clear and high quality contents

results.content: I’ve found this course really helpful and informative even though I’m in GDPR for a while. It sums up the main concepts and requirements from GDPR and gives you not only a basic understanding of it but also some guidance from where to start on the project, what steps have to be taken, etc. And also, Roland spent some time on describing security concepts - this might be helpful for non-security specialists who are involved in GDPR implementation. What makes the course extremely valuable is a set of working documents and templates provided by Roland. I doubt you can find sth similar anywhere else for that price. I’d strongly recommend this course to anyone who is in GDPR subject.

response.content: Thx a lot Dmitriy for this detailed review
response.content_html: Thx a lot Dmitriy for this detailed review
